title: Beezoe25
author: Beezoe25
content: SeanbDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Never trust those mining apps.If you want to mine bitcoin, get yourself a good ASIC and join a mining pool, that would be costly and you will need to calculate if mining is going to be profitable for you.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: I don't know what application you are talking about. Just take note that you can't mine bitcoin just with running an application. That's not how bitcoin is mined at all and it seems that someone is trying to scam you. There are scammers showing a fake number as your bitcoin balance, so that you (wrongly) think that you have mined bitcoin.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMSeanbDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks  In addition to what others have said about virtually ALL 'Bitcoin mining apps' being scams I suggest you read https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2415854.0 point-3 for the reason 'apps' cannot be used.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: It seems that you downloaded a game called bitcoin miner or you might be downloaded an Android app from other sources because I can't find the exact name on PlayStore instead most of the bitcoin miner app out there includes cloud mining at the end. I check most of the apps out there with that keyword and most of the reviews are negative or bad. So you will never payout after 90 days and actually if you mine directly to the pool with real miner sample antminer s19 then the payout is instantly in your account until you reach the minimum withdrawal from the pool anytime you can request for withdrawal. So any miner apps all of them are scam and beware to install them in your phone it maybe collect sensitive data from your phone.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks It all screams scam and probably a malware. If you already installed it on your device, please uninstall it immediately. Members have already given you some sound advice, there is no bitcoin mining app of that nature. You need to have hardware know as ASICs in order to be able to mine Bitcoin.

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: Is either you talking about Bitcoin mining which claims to provide an opportunity for people to mine the latest digital cryptocurrency on crypto cloud servers or the app that claims not to mine Bitcoin on your device but compensates players by returning a percentage of their revenue to the player community?None of these can be trusted the first option always ends up scamming the user and the second you'll mine with your data. Besides, there's a high chance of your devices getting infected with viruses.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Don't install applications because you are curious. Applications are very dangerous and your devices can be infected, compromised and your funds can be stolen.Why do you want to try 90 days and just wait for luck to get your rewards? If even if they pay you, they can cheat you by censoring your reward, pay less than what you should receive.Cloud mining is very scam too.Cloudmining 101 (ponzi risk assessment)

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: Since you are very new to the forum, you probably don't know about it. but as most people suggest. avoid any cloud mining. or in a smartphone application that you can download and run. take care of the data on your cellphone which might be a loophole for hacking the device you are using.if you are interested in mining maybe you should read more information in mining threads.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I don't know which app exactly you're talking about but I did saw one app on play store called "Bitcoin miner" and when I read the reviews left by those who have tried the app out I just knew nothing good is going to come out from the app. So Op you should try to read the reviews of the all you're talking about it might not be the same with the one I checked. And again you should try not to trust all this apps and site that promise to give you rewards without you doing anything. Have you ever sat down to ask yourself; where will they get the money to pay me? What have I done to deserve this kind of payment? What's in it for them? Asking yourself this type of questions help you know what step to take if your truly deserve to by paid or you're just been greedy looking for free money.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on February 14, 2023, 03:45:49 AMSo Op you should try to read the reviews of the all you're talking about it might not be the same with the one I checked. Read reviews about the application/software to judge whether it's legit or scam is pointless because they can easily create fake reviews in order to convince other peoples. The best way if you want to check the reviews of application/software related to Bitcoin is this forum.QuoteHave you ever sat down to ask yourself; where will they get the money to pay me? What have I done to deserve this kind of payment? What's in it for them? Asking yourself this type of questions help you know what step to take if your truly deserve to by paid or you're just been greedy looking for free money. Most cloud mining tricked their customers by promising the fixed payment for every week or money after you make deposit depends on the plan offered by the sites. They're lying if they will use that money to buy mining rigs and they will take care of it, but in the end they will scam even though the plan is make sense.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: OP can you take your time to share a screenshot of the app? Some Bitcoin faucets pay in very tiny amounts of Satoshis when the withdrawal minimum is meet, I am not sure they still exists today, I myself made some mBTC through one of those apps but I uninstalled because it takes forever to get the withdrawal limit. If you are not claiming Sats every hours or 4 hours then that's a fake cloud mining app, do not waste your time on the app, in the end, you might not get anything after the 90 days you claimed to get paid.

comments.author: HajiBagi
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on February 13, 2023, 05:32:44 PMI don't know what application you are talking about. Just take note that you can't mine bitcoin just with running an application. That's not how bitcoin is mined at all and it seems that someone is trying to scam you. There are scammers showing a fake number as your bitcoin balance, so that you (wrongly) think that you have mined bitcoin.Great observation, mate, this is the same way one of my friends got scammed by receiving a code from his bitcoin account and not asking anyone about what he sees, it's better that he ask in the forum to know what he is going through than taking the risk of being scammed, although no one is perfect, asking what he or she doesn't understand is not a crime here, the forum is made for many reasons, and asking about what you don't understand is one of of the most important thing you should know as a new member.

comments.author: Maestro75
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks Be careful what you download online so you do not have to cause your device damage with virus and malware or even indirectly expose your devise to hacks. Bitcoin is no longer that easy to get like it was before some years ago when it was given to encourage people to try it or to spread awareness. Whether in play to earn games or faucets, it is hard getting real traded tokens for free anymore.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks Should there be any recognized bitcoin mining procedure other than setting up a mining rig, getting yourself an ASIC miner and all other requirements needed for setting up a bitcoin mining rig, talking about other mining apps, these are centralized individually developed altcoins minings that pairs resemblance with bitcoin from the name they bear but were not bitcoin mining apps on a real sense, to me some of them were just a waste of time because you get nothing instead than going through surveys and other procedures that could be time wasting as well, if you want to mine bitcoin then get ready in solving the complex mathematical equations and compete with other miners in doing this.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: Quote from: rozak on February 14, 2023, 03:29:06 AMSince you are very new to the forum, you probably don't know about it. but as most people suggest. avoid any cloud mining. or in a smartphone application that you can download and run. take care of the data on your cellphone which might be a loophole for hacking the device you are using.if you are interested in mining maybe you should read more information in mining threads.Op maybe knew bitcoin from other sources but his approach to mining bitcoin with software indicates that he is not educated well about bitcoin mining. Even no normal computer can mine bitcoin LOL. OP stay away from these scam applications, they only waste your time and scam you in the end,

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMSeanbDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks That app is fake and the most crappy thing I' ever came across in my life ... Regular apps don't mine Bitcoin, AFAIK.The BTC mining process requires alot of energy to conserve and drive the rig, which is impossible to account for so easily.No matter how many reviews you see in there, it's fake!! ... they've even improvised this days and have made much more unidentifiable reviews; back then, the work was obviously fake and crappy. Don't even dare to see what happens, cus you'll be asked to deposit a certain amount of BTC first -- which makes it a provable SCAM.!Sandra 🧑‍🦰

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Beezoe25 on February 13, 2023, 05:24:59 PMDoes anyone a mining app called Bitcoin Miner just want to know if they pay out after the 90 days??Thanks There is no such thing as a Bitcoin mining app. In the best case scenario you will be left with nothing, in the worst case scenario you will install malware on your device. Any app claiming to offer Bitcoin mining capabilities is likely a scam and should be avoided.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on February 14, 2023, 11:12:54 PMThere is no such thing as a Bitcoin mining app. In the best case scenario you will be left with nothing, in the worst case scenario you will install malware on your device. Besides the chance of installing a malware, it's possible that they ask for identity verification and a deposit to be able to make a withdrawal. So, the worst case scenario is installing a malware, your personal data being stolen and losing some money as withdrawal fee or something like that.

comments.author: Fatema440
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on February 13, 2023, 05:29:47 PMNever trust those mining apps.If you want to mine bitcoin, get yourself a good ASIC and join a mining pool, that would be costly and you will need to calculate if mining is going to be profitable for you.I also think so. They want to make people fool. But those are fake. If someone ask for investment to speed up the mining, we must avoid those type of asking.
